hero.title: A world where every individual with MED13 syndrome reaches their full potential
hero.subtitle: The MED13 Foundation unites families, researchers, and clinicians to accelerate scientific discovery, fund research toward treatments and a cure, and support families through their diagnostic journey.

about.title: Who We Are
about.subtitle: Building a foundation for discovery, treatment, and hope
about.storyContent1: The MED13 Foundation was established by families directly affected by MED13 syndrome, one of the rarest neurodevelopmental disorders with just over 51 identified patients worldwide. Following the first comprehensive characterization of MED13 syndrome in 2018, our community recognized the urgent need for organized advocacy and research infrastructure.
about.storyContent2: As parents navigating this ultra-rare diagnosis, we understand the isolation, uncertainty, and determination that defines this journey. We've witnessed our children's struggles with speech, learning, and development – but also their incredible resilience and unique personalities that shine through every challenge.
about.communityItem1: 51+ families worldwide connected through shared experience
about.communityItem2: Researchers and clinicians pioneering understanding of the Mediator complex
about.communityItem3: Advocates and allies committed to improving outcomes for all individuals with neurodevelopmental differences

getInvolved.title: Get Involved
getInvolved.subtitle: Four ways to make an impact in the MED13 community
getInvolved.researchDesc: Your participation drives discovery. Enroll in our patient registry and contribute to the biorepository to provide crucial data for natural history studies and enable researchers worldwide to study MED13 syndrome.
getInvolved.boardDesc: Shape the future of MED13 research and advocacy. We're seeking parents, medical advisors, fundraising professionals, and advocates to guide our strategic direction through quarterly meetings and committee work.
getInvolved.volunteerDesc: Every talent makes a difference. We need help with website development, grant writing, event planning, social media, translation, data management, and family mentorship for newly diagnosed families.
getInvolved.donateDesc: Your financial contribution accelerates research and provides direct support to families navigating MED13 syndrome. Every donation brings us closer to treatments and a cure.
